intro: Vincetoxicum tuberculatum, commonly known as the rough thimbleweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes other familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features a slender, upright stem with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in tiny, raised bumps. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Vincetoxicum tuberculatum is often found in moist, disturbed soils along streambanks and roadsides.
